title: Families reunite on the Mexico-US border
description: More than 200 people gathered at the Rio Grand River on the Mexico-US border to reunite with their family members.

title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Salah, Toney, Mount, Silva, Martinez
description: Which player's form makes him 'a must' for the World Cup in Qatar? Find out in Garth Crooks' latest Team of the Week.

title: Rugby League World Cup: Joseph Manu scores superb solo try
description: Joseph Manu scores a superb solo try for New Zealand in their World Cup opener against Lebanon at the Halliwell Jones Stadium, Warrington.

title: Liverpool 1-0 Man City: Anfield still a tough prospect for Pep Guardiola's side
description: Yet again a visit to Anfield proved to be tricky for Manchester City, despite their superb start to the Premier League season, writes Phil McNulty.

title: Liverpool 1-0 Manchester City: Pep Guardiola says crowd threw coins at him
description: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola says he had coins thrown at him during his side's 1-0 defeat at Liverpool.

title: Man dies in suspected gas explosion in Denny
description: Emergency services were called to an outbuilding in Denny on Sunday afternoon.

title: Liverpool 1-0 Manchester City: Mohamed Salah scores winner
description: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah scores and Jurgen Klopp is sent off as Manchester City lose for the first time in the league this season.

title: Turkey mine deaths: President Erdogan criticised over 'destiny' comments
description: The coal mine explosion in northern Turkey on Friday night left 41 dead and 28 others injured.

title: Hull City 0-2 Birmingham City: Troy Deeney & Juninho Bacuna give Blues win
description: Birmingham continue their improved recent form with a win at struggling Hull, with the game delayed because the goals were too big.

title: El Clasico: Real Madrid beat Barcelona 3-1 at Bernabeu
description: Clinical Real Madrid beat Barcelona in the 250th El Clasico to go top of La Liga and inflict their rivals' first league defeat of the season.

title: Clannad founder Noel Duggan dies aged 73
description: Clannad's remaining members said they were "heartbroken" by the sudden death of Noel Duggan aged 73.

title: UN condemns 'deeply distressing' discovery of 92 naked migrants at Greece-Turkey border
description: The men were found alive on the Greek-Turkish border, but exactly what happened is not clear.

title: Ethiopia's Tigray conflict: Civilian bloodbath warning as offensive escalates
description: Cities in Tigray are reportedly being carpet bombed as food and medical supplies are running out.

title: Leeds 0-1 Arsenal: Bukayo Saka scores winning goal
description: Premier League leaders Arsenal move four points clear by holding on to win at Leeds in a match delayed by around 40 minutes because of a power outage.

title: Manchester United 0-0 Newcastle United: Draw extends visitors' unbeaten run
description: Eddie Howe's side extend their unbeaten run to five games after holding Manchester United to a goalless draw at Old Trafford.

title: Aston Villa 0-2 Chelsea: Mason Mount double extends Blues' winning run
description: Mason Mount scores his first club goals of the season as Chelsea beat Aston Villa to continue Graham Potter's unbeaten start as manager.

title: Biden 'disagreed' with Liz Truss plan for tax cut for wealthy
description: The US president criticised Prime Minister Liz Truss's original plan to cut taxes for the wealthy.

title: Bill Sweeney: RFU chief executive determined to sort 'broken' English game
description: Bill Sweeney, RFU chief executive, says clubs have been "living beyond their means" and vows to "sort out" the "broken" English game.

title: China Communist Party Congress: What matters to people in Beijing?
description: As China's Communist Party Congress kicks off in Beijing, people tell the BBC what they want from the event.

title: Mourne Mountains: Three young people injured in Slieve Binnian fall
description: Mourne Mountain Rescue Team helped the group after two members fell 30m on Slieve Binnian

title: Track Cycling World Championships: GB's Neah Evans wins points race gold for first world title
description: Britain's Neah Evans wins her first World Championship title with victory in the women's points race in France.

title: WSL: Toone scores second as United dominate Brighton
description: Ella Toone puts Manchester United two goals up against Brighton in the Women's Super League with a neat finish.

title: Mum creates inclusive toy brand to 'positively' represent her son
description: Essex toy creator Desriee Asomuyide wants every child to see themselves in toys and books.

title: Claressa Shields v Savannah Marshall: Epic offers hope when boxing needs it
description: At a time when boxing is facing significant bad publicity, the epic fight between Claressa Shields and Savannah Marshall in London offers reason for optimism.

title: Tesco warns public faces hardship in wake of interest rates rise
description: John Allan told the BBC he feels a "moral responsibility" to help those affected by rates going up.

title: Peter Tobin: Serial killer's ashes scattered at sea
description: Tobin, who died in hospital aged 76, was cremated after no-one came forward to claim his body.

title: Shields v Marshall: 'GWOAT' Claressa Shields and Savannah Marshall on pushing women's boxing
description: Following their incredible middleweight title fight, Claressa Shields speaks about proving her "GWOAT" status as Savannah Marshall reflects on their all women fighting card on a historic evening in London.

title: Police probe after man's body found in woodland in Loughton
description: Death of man found on land close to an industrial estate is being treated as suspicious, police say.

title: Get behind Liz Truss, Chancellor Jeremy Hunt tells Tory MPs
description: Jeremy Hunt calls for unity, amid talk of backbenchers plotting to remove the PM from office.

title: Xi Jinping speech: Zero-Covid and zero solutions
description: There was no acknowledgement of the social and economic pain being caused by his flagship policy.

title: T20 World Cup: Namibia shock Sri Lanka in opening game
description: Namibia, ranked 14th in the world, shock Asia Cup champions Sri Lanka as the Men's T20 World Cup starts in spectacular fashion.

title: Deontay Wilder makes winning return with first-round knockout of Robert Helenius
description: Former heavyweight world champion Deontay Wilder knocks out Robert Helenius in the first round as he makes a winning return to boxing in Brooklyn, New York.

title: Jack Kavanagh: 'It meant finding a new way of navigating the world'
description: Keen sportsman Jack Kavanagh was paralysed 12 years ago, but an exoskeleton is helping him walk again.

title: Jeremy Hunt to join Liz Truss at Chequers for talks on economic plans
description: The new chancellor warns of "very difficult decisions" as he heads to Chequers to hold talks with the PM.

title: New Zealand score 10 tries in dominant Wales win
description: Wales are humbled as hosts New Zealand run in 10 tries in front of a sell-out crowd in Waitakere.

title: Ebola in Uganda: Three-week lockdown announced for two districts
description: There have been 19 deaths and 58 cases reported in Uganda during this outbreak.

title: The Papers: 'Hunt takes control' amid 'secret plot to oust PM'
description: The new chancellor's plan to delay Liz Truss's income tax cut dominates Sunday's papers.

title: Paddington Bears pictured with Camilla as tributes to late Queen sent to charity
description: More than a thousand teddies left at royal residences by members of the public will go to a children's charity.
